channel.title: NDTV News Search Records Found 1000
channel.description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

item.title: Protests In LA Intensify Over Federal Immigration Sweeps, Tear Gas Used

media:content.media:description: The protesters were heard chanting: "This is what democracy looks like!"

item.description: Protests outside a federal detention centre in Los Angeles turned tense as law enforcement agencies, including the California National Guard and Department of Homeland Security, fired non-lethal tear gas outside the facility to disperse protesters.
item.content:encoded: Protests outside a federal detention centre in Los Angeles turned tense as law enforcement agencies, including the California National Guard and Department of Homeland Security, fired non-lethal tear gas outside the facility to disperse protesters.

item.title: Greta Thunberg Back In Sweden After Deportation From Israel

media:content.media:description: Activist Greta Thunberg returned home to Sweden late Tuesday after being deported from Israel.

item.description: Activist Greta Thunberg returned home to Sweden late Tuesday after being deported from Israel, lambasting the country for its "violations of international law and war crimes" in Gaza.
item.content:encoded: Activist Greta Thunberg returned home to Sweden late Tuesday after being deported from Israel, lambasting the country for its "violations of international law and war crimes" in Gaza.

item.title: "No Food, No Water, No Peace": Gaza Family Mourn 3-Year-Old Shot Dead
item.description: Gazan mother Amal Abu Shalouf ran her hand over her son's face and hair, a brief farewell before a man abruptly sealed the body bag carrying the three-year-old who was killed just hours earlier on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: Gazan mother Amal Abu Shalouf ran her hand over her son's face and hair, a brief farewell before a man abruptly sealed the body bag carrying the three-year-old who was killed just hours earlier on Tuesday.

item.title: Pupil Stabs To Death Assistant At French School
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday condemned a "senseless wave of violence" after a teaching assistant stabbed by a 15-year-old pupil outside a school in the east of the country died of her wounds.
item.content:encoded: French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday condemned a "senseless wave of violence" after a teaching assistant stabbed by a 15-year-old pupil outside a school in the east of the country died of her wounds.

item.title: Man Convicted In 1994 Graduation Party Massacre In US Arrested In Los Angeles Raids

media:content.media:description: Phan's arrest was one among dozens made by Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

item.description: A 49-year-old Vietnamese national, convicted in a notorious gang-related mass shooting, is among several illegal immigrants arrested by ICE in a weekend raid across Los Angeles that triggered violent protests.
item.content:encoded: A 49-year-old Vietnamese national, convicted in a notorious gang-related mass shooting, is among several illegal immigrants arrested by ICE in a weekend raid across Los Angeles that triggered violent protests.

item.title: Goodbye Lenin? Russians Flock To See Bolshevik Leader's Tomb Before Closure

media:content.media:description: People walk near St. Basil's Cathedral and the Mausoleum of Soviet founder Vladimir Lenin in Red Square

item.description: Russians are flocking to catch what some fear could be a final glimpse of the embalmed body of Bolshevik leader Vladimir Lenin before his tomb on Moscow's Red Square, long a place of pilgrimage for communists, closes for repairs until 2027.
item.content:encoded: Russians are flocking to catch what some fear could be a final glimpse of the embalmed body of Bolshevik leader Vladimir Lenin before his tomb on Moscow's Red Square, long a place of pilgrimage for communists, closes for repairs until 2027.

item.title: US Slaps Sanctions On El Chapo's Sons, Announces $10 Million Reward

media:content.media:description: The sanctions freeze any property and financial interests linked to El Chapo's son

item.description: The US government on Monday sanctioned the fugitive sons of drug lord Joaquin 'El Chapo' Guzman, and announced a $10 million reward for information leading to their arrests.
item.content:encoded: The US government on Monday sanctioned the fugitive sons of drug lord Joaquin 'El Chapo' Guzman, and announced a $10 million reward for information leading to their arrests.

item.title: 4-Day Closed-Door Talks On India-US Trade Deal Conclude. What Was Discussed

media:content.media:description: India and the US aim to boost annual bilateral trade from $190 billion to $500 billion by 2030.

item.description: Significant progress was made in the latest round of talks between India and the United States over a possible interim trade deal expected within weeks
item.content:encoded: Significant progress was made in the latest round of talks between India and the United States over a possible interim trade deal expected within weeks

item.title: What Is Meta's 'Superintelligence' That Zuckerberg Is Hiring Personally For

media:content.media:description: AGI refers to AI that can outperform humans across a broad range of cognitive tasks

item.description: AGI, while still a theoretical concept, refers to AI that can outperform humans across a broad range of cognitive tasks. Many experts believe such capabilities may be decades awayif they are possible at all.
item.content:encoded: AGI, while still a theoretical concept, refers to AI that can outperform humans across a broad range of cognitive tasks. Many experts believe such capabilities may be decades awayif they are possible at all.

item.title: Syria Mandates Full Body Swimwear For Women On Public Beaches

media:content.media:description: Private beach clubs do not have to abide by the new rules.

item.description: Syria's new Islamist authorities said on Tuesday that women going to public beaches must wear burkinis or other "decent" clothes that cover the body, giving some private venues an exemption.
item.content:encoded: Syria's new Islamist authorities said on Tuesday that women going to public beaches must wear burkinis or other "decent" clothes that cover the body, giving some private venues an exemption.

item.title: Missile Launched From Yemen Toward Israel, Says Israeli Military

media:content.media:description: Yemen has been attacking Israel in what it says is solidarity with Gaza(File)

item.description: The Israeli military said on Tuesday that it was working to intercept a missile launched from Yemen toward Israel, hours after Israel deployed its navy to hit targets in the Yemeni Red Sea port of Hodeidah.
item.content:encoded: The Israeli military said on Tuesday that it was working to intercept a missile launched from Yemen toward Israel, hours after Israel deployed its navy to hit targets in the Yemeni Red Sea port of Hodeidah.

item.title: IMF Team Makes First Syria Visit Since 2009

media:content.media:description: IMF said it had held useful discussions with Syria's economic team last month.

item.description: An IMF team visited Syria for the first time since 2009 to take part in efforts to rebuild the economy after years of civil war and the fall of Bashar al-Assad, the lender said Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: An IMF team visited Syria for the first time since 2009 to take part in efforts to rebuild the economy after years of civil war and the fall of Bashar al-Assad, the lender said Tuesday.

item.title: US Envoy Says He Does Not Think Palestinian State Is US Policy Goal: Report

media:content.media:description: Huckabee, the former governor of Arkansas, is staunch pro-Israel conservative

item.description: US Ambassador to Israel Mike Huckabee said he did not think that an independent Palestinian state remains a goal of US foreign policy, according to an interview with Bloomberg News released on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: US Ambassador to Israel Mike Huckabee said he did not think that an independent Palestinian state remains a goal of US foreign policy, according to an interview with Bloomberg News released on Tuesday.

item.title: 1,500-Year-Old Madaba Mosaic Map Helps Archaeologists Find Lost City Of Tharais In Jordan

media:content.media:description: Not just a religious centre, Tharais was also economically robust.

item.description: Recognised as the oldest surviving cartographic depiction of the Holy Lands, the Madaba Mosaic Map was crafted during the reign of Emperor Justinian.
item.content:encoded: Recognised as the oldest surviving cartographic depiction of the Holy Lands, the Madaba Mosaic Map was crafted during the reign of Emperor Justinian.

item.title: Flight To Greece Returns To Zurich After 32-Hour Trip Due To Bad Weather

media:content.media:description: The plane returned to its point of departure 32 hours later.(Representative pic)

item.description: A flight from Switzerland to Greece had to return to its point of departure after 32 hours in the air due to bad weather.
item.content:encoded: A flight from Switzerland to Greece had to return to its point of departure after 32 hours in the air due to bad weather.

item.title: Greta Thunberg Jabs Trump Over His Snide Remark, Says "World Needs More..."

media:content.media:description: Greta Thunberg slammed Donald Trump after he described her as a "young, angry person"

item.description: "I think the world needs many more young angry women, to be honest," she said, after arriving in Paris. Her British-flagged ship "Madleen" was intercepted by Israeli forces in the early hours of Monday, after which she was deported from Israel.
item.content:encoded: "I think the world needs many more young angry women, to be honest," she said, after arriving in Paris. Her British-flagged ship "Madleen" was intercepted by Israeli forces in the early hours of Monday, after which she was deported from Israel.

item.title: EU Removes UAE From 'High-Risk' Money-Laundering List

media:content.media:description: EU removes UAE from the list of countries that need extra monitoring of their money laundering controls.

item.description: The EU on Tuesday announced the removal of the United Arab Emirates from its money-laundering "high-risk" list but added Monaco alongside nine other jurisdictions.
item.content:encoded: The EU on Tuesday announced the removal of the United Arab Emirates from its money-laundering "high-risk" list but added Monaco alongside nine other jurisdictions.

item.title: As Mass Shooting In Austria Kills 10, A Look At Europe's History Of Gun Violence

media:content.media:description: Gun Violence: Europe has had many cases of mass shootings in the last 40 years (Representational)

item.description: A gunman killed ten people at a secondary school in the southern Austrian city of Graz on Tuesday, in the worst school shooting in the country's modern history. At least 10 others were injured in the school massacre.
item.content:encoded: A gunman killed ten people at a secondary school in the southern Austrian city of Graz on Tuesday, in the worst school shooting in the country's modern history. At least 10 others were injured in the school massacre.

item.title: "Tarred And Feathered": US Speaker Calls For California Governor's Torture

media:content.media:description: Speaker Mike Johnson said that California Governor Gavin Newsom should be "tarred and feathered"

item.description: To put an end to the protests, about 700 Marines have been deployed in Los Angeles and 4,000 National Guard troops have been mobilised. The American military does not have any domestic law enforcement role.
item.content:encoded: To put an end to the protests, about 700 Marines have been deployed in Los Angeles and 4,000 National Guard troops have been mobilised. The American military does not have any domestic law enforcement role.

item.title: Iran Executes 9 People Arrested Over Planned Islamic State Attack

media:content.media:description: The arrests had taken place months after a deadly Islamic State attack on the Iranian parliament.

item.description: Iran executed nine people it said were members of the Islamic State, state media reported on Tuesday, after their arrest in early 2018 during clashes in which three members of the Revolutionary Guards were killed.
item.content:encoded: Iran executed nine people it said were members of the Islamic State, state media reported on Tuesday, after their arrest in early 2018 during clashes in which three members of the Revolutionary Guards were killed.
